text:
100-110 Bridge Street, west side, from and including Talman, to and including York Streets. The view shows the Eskimo Pie Corporation building.

February 7, 1927.

57-65 Talman Street, north side, west of Bridge Street. Also seen is Bridge Street, east side, from Talman to York Streets. In the background is a gas tank of the Brooklyn Union Gas Light Co.

November 11, 1927.

P. L. Sperr.

Bridge Street, north from the S.E. corner of Talman Street, showing at the N.W. corner the N.Y. Eskimo Pie Co. building.

April 5, 1938.

P. L. Sperr

113-123 Bridge Street, east side, between Talman Street, (left) and Prospect Street (right). The west side of this street shows the vacant area upon which stood houses and buildings numbering 112-120 Bridge Street. In the background is the Naval Branch of the Y.M.C.A. located between Prospect and Sands Streets facing on Charles Street.

April 5, 1938.

P. L. Sperr

Talman Street, (center of the view) east from Bridge Street. (fire hydrants thereon) to Charles Street, showing also Bridge Street, east side, north and south of Talman Street.

April 5, 1938.

P. L. Sperr
